hero.title: What if we added exploration to our workouts?
hero.p1: Performance, the stopwatch, pushing your limits: these are magnificent drivers of our sports practice. Many of us love analyzing our stats after a good run.
hero.p2: But sometimes, the urge to run doesn't come from the need to break a record. It comes from the desire to discover, to get some fresh air, to see new neighborhoods. Pounce was born from a simple question: how can we give as much value to exploration as we do to performance? How can we turn our cities and trails into incredible playgrounds?
hero.p3: We believe physical effort shouldn't just be measured in numbers, but in territories discovered and experiences lived. Sport should no longer be social network, but a social vector of discovery.

origin.title: The starting point: An idea born on the GR20, with my hiking buddies: Bilal, Fares, Mathias, Hippolyte, Ethan, Anthony et Mathis.
origin.p1: The idea for this project took root on the trails of the GR20, in Corsica.
origin.p2: After days of intense hiking to finish this legendary adventure, a thought struck me: beyond the memories and the fatigue, I would have loved to keep a "certified" trace of this achievement. A small medal, even a virtual one, symbolizing the conquest of this specific path.
origin.p3: That is the essence of Pounce (the momentum, the footprint). The desire to create a space that doesn't replace (actualy) your usual tracking apps, but adds to them to mark the routes you've accomplished with a milestone.

goals.title: A new way to set goals
goals.subtitle: Pounce is an emerging project, a laboratory of ideas for those who see sport as a way to discover their environment. Our approach is based on a few simple ideas:

tangible.title: Tangible challenges
tangible.desc: We select and create specific routes. The goal isn't to run as fast as possible, but to "complete" an iconic trace, like your city's infrastructure.

collection.title: Collecting experiences
collection.desc: Eventually, we want each completed route to earn you a certification (badges, points), like a sports travel diary.

wallOfFame.title: A shared "Wall of Fame"
wallOfFame.desc: No news feed where we constantly compare ourselves, just a simple honor roll to celebrate those who took up the challenge, each at their own pace.

future.title: Present and Future
future.subtitle: The first test: Parisian Metros
future.p1: Today, Pounce is taking its very first steps. To test the concept, we are launching a first urban exploration challenge: the lines of the Paris metro.
future.p2: Get out of the underground trains, download our tracks, and rediscover Paris by running above Line 1 or Line 6.
future.p3: If you like the idea, this is just the beginning. We're already imagining what's next: subways in other cities (Lyon...), cycling challenges along the Châteaux de la Loire, and of course, the validation of major hiking trails.

cta.title: The project is in your hands
cta.p1: Pounce is an "MVP" (Minimum Viable Product). It's a first version, free and constantly evolving.
cta.p2: Because this project was designed for amateur athletes and curious minds, your feedback is essential to decide what happens next.
cta.p3: Does the idea resonate with you? Is there a game-changing feature missing? Would you like to see a specific challenge created near you?
